keyword: how many calories in oz of vodka
title: How Many Calories in 1 oz of Vodka?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in 1 oz of vodka, including full nutrition breakdown, alcohol content, and variations for different proofs.
h1: How Many Calories in 1 oz of Vodka?
assumptions: Standard 80-proof (40% ABV) unflavored vodka; 1 oz = 29.57 ml fluid ounce.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, proof, flavoring, and serving size. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One ounce of 80-proof vodka has about 64 calories, all from alcohol with no carbs, fat, or protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a standard shot of vodka?
faqs.a: A 1.5 oz shot of 80-proof vodka has about 96 calories.

faqs.q: Does vodka have carbs or sugar?
faqs.a: Plain vodka has 0 g carbs and 0 g sugars; calories come solely from alcohol.

faqs.q: How does proof affect calories in vodka?
faqs.a: Higher proof means more calories per oz; 80-proof is ~64 kcal, 100-proof ~80 kcal.

faqs.q: Are there any nutrients in vodka besides calories?
faqs.a: No protein, fat, fiber, or sodium; it's essentially pure alcohol calories.

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 oz of flavored vodka?
faqs.a: Can add 5-20 kcal from sugars, depending on the flavor and brand.
